page.title: 11FARMING, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: {General With the exception of a small dairy herd,cattle mainly were kept to fatten, before going to market at Louth. Arable farming accounted for most of the land use. Crops grown:- Winter wheat,Spring Barley,Oats, Sugar Beet,Oilseed Rape,Peas & Potatoes. Asparagus is grown by one farmer to fill in small spaces and as a help to crop rotation. The same farmer has a poultry production unit dealt with 150 000 turkeys a year from Day-old to 20 weeks, live weight about 30lbs. Then they are processed and sold.
